content: the court of appeals in laquila recently made a final ruling on a case that lasted from 2016 to 2020 the court partially accepted the appeal and declared the succession of a person meaning that the deceased persons assets would be divided among the parties involved in the lawsuit they also determined that a specific property should be assigned to the heirs of another person the court ordered the appellants to reimburse the opposing parties for their costs including professional fees and expenses throughout the case the court made various decisions and judgments based on legal principles and previous rulings there were disputes over the ownership of certain properties and the restitution of income derived from those properties the court rejected some claims for restitution and upheld others they also ordered the drawing of lots to determine the allocation of certain shares of the estate the court addressed issues related to the payment of legal fees and rejected a petition to revoke an injunction the final ruling was made on november 3 2020 and deposited in the clerks office on november 17 2020
